qas.question: What did Deists and skeptics join together to fight against?

context: Steven Waldman notes that; "The evangelicals provided the political muscle for the efforts of Madison and Jefferson, not merely because they wanted to block official churches but because they wanted to keep <a0_0>the <b5_0>spiritual and secular worlds<b5_0/><a0_0/> apart." "Religious freedom resulted from <a1_0><b6_0>an alliance of unlikely partners<b6_0/><a1_0/>," writes the <a2_0><b7_0>historian<b7_0/><a2_0/> Frank Lambert in his book <a3_0><b8_0>The Founding Fathers and the Place of Religion in America<b8_0/><a3_0/>. "New Light evangelicals such as Isaac Bachus and John Leland joined forces with Deists and skeptics such as James Madison and Thomas Jefferson to fight for <a4_0>a <b9_0>complete separation of church and state<a4_0/>.<b9_0/>"
